[Updating] QM Notes: Density Matrix, Entropy, and Entanglement

Consider a quantum system which is in a statistical ensemble of several different quantum state \(\ket{\psi(\lambda)}\) with a classical probability of \(f(\lambda) \geq 0\). Then the expectation value of an Operator \(\hat{A}\) is \[ \braket{A} = \int f(\lambda) \braket{\psi(\lambda)|\hat{A}|\psi(\lambda)} \mathrm{d} \lambda \] or \[ \braket{A} = \sum_i f_i \braket{\psi_i|\hat{A}|\psi_i} \] in discrete case. Now we can introduce the density operator \(\hat{\rho}\), which is defined by \[ \hat{\rho} \equiv \int \mathrm{d}\lambda f(\lambda)\ket{\psi(\lambda)}\bra{\psi(\lambda)} \] or \[ \hat{\rho} \equiv \sum_i f_i \ket{\psi_i}\bra{\psi_i} \] s.t. \(\braket{A} = \mathrm{tr}(\hat{\rho}\cdot \hat{A})\) , which can be easily proved as follows: \[ \begin{aligned} \mathrm{tr}(\hat{\rho}\cdot \hat{A}) &= \sum_j \bra{\psi_j} \hat{\rho}\hat{A}\ket{\psi_j} \newline &= \sum_i \sum_j f_i \braket{\psi_j|\psi_i}\bra{\psi_i}\hat{A}\ket{\psi_j} \newline &= \sum_i f_i \braket{\psi_i|\hat{A}|\psi_i} \end{aligned} \]
